title: Ticket #2603: Condor_q -analyze chokes on string attributes that end in backslash
description:
If a machine or job ad contains an attribute whose value is a string ending in backslash, the classad analysis code fails when trying to convert the ad from old to new classads. String attributes ending in backslash are common on Windows.

The conversion function toNewClassAd() appears to be tripping over the funky escaping rules of old classads. But now that we're using new classads everywhere, this conversion function is unnecessary.
remarks:
2011-Oct-31 15:39:14 by jfrey:
I've attached a patch that removes calls to the conversion function toNewClassAd() in the analysis code. In addition to fixing this problem, it gives us a 15% speedup (unoptimized, comparing 1 job to 1100 machines).

2011-Oct-31 15:59:47 by danb:
Code review: looks good to me for 7.6.
attachments:
• condor_q.patch 3587 bytes added by jfrey on 2011-Oct-31 20:37:32 UTC.
    Patch to disable conversion functions in classad analysis code.
